Job Posting:175840 - Position: S26 Consulting Analyst Development Program - Summer Analyst (Intern) 175840 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/01/2026 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 12/04/2025 02:16 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Accenture Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Consulting Analyst Development Program - Summer Analyst (Intern) 175840 Co-op Position Multiple Locations Canada 4 months CAD 28.0 per hour for 0 Major List Job Title: Entry Level Consulting Analyst Development Program - Summer Analyst (Intern) - Canada - NAELFY26 Job ID: r00295225 Location: Alberta - Calgary, British Columbia - Vancouver, Ontario - Ottawa, Ontario - Toronto, Quebec - Montreal Application Deadline: January 1, 2026 at 11:59pm Job Description Jumpstart your career with the Accenture Consulting Summer Analyst (Internship)* Development Program. Use your strengths to help top clients tackle real business challenges while exploring how technology can drive innovation and transformation. As a Summer Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to demonstrate your consulting skills in a supportive, team-oriented environment. You'll be part of a culture that values collaboration, inclusivity, and empowering everyone to thrive and build a meaningful career. *Internship program starts in June and runs approximately 10 weeks What Your Summer Role Could Look Like… • Be part of a meaningful summer project where your ideas and input truly matter-you'll help solve real business problems using the latest tech and tools, culminating with an internship deliverable and presentation. • Collaborate in-person with your team, clients, and company leaders to build relationships, learn from others, and contribute to a vibrant and inclusive workplace. • Build core consulting skills while helping clients drive transformation and create meaningful impact. • Provide support in strategic development, process improvement, and organizational change initiatives. • Analyze data to uncover insights, solve complex problems, and inform business decisions. • Gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge tools like AI, cloud platforms, and advanced analytics. • Receive ongoing support and guidance from a mentor (or "buddy") who'll help you grow professionally and navigate your summer experience. Apply soft skills, including communication, adaptability, eagerness to learn, and strong organizational abilities. • CDP - Applied Intelligence • Use quantitative methods and statistical models to create insights, patterns, and outcomes from data to inform strategic decisions • Utilize AI to unlock new potential for businesses by augmenting and extending human capabilities. Additionally, unlock the value in unstructured data through search analytics, natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning, and create visualizations that make data consumable and actionable CDP - Song Immerse yourself in a global creative agency, working on cutting-edge projects for some of the world's leading brands, and helping shape the future of digital experiences. You will have exposure to projects in marketing, e-commerce, UX design, and product and services development, contributing to client business growth through relevance. • Marketing: Craft compelling digital campaigns that drive brand awareness and customer engagement. • E-commerce: Build high-performance e-commerce platforms and optimize online shopping experiences. • Design & Digital Products: Design and develop innovative digital products. • Services: Improve customer experiences through service design and optimization digital service delivery. • Interest or experience in areas such as marketing, customer service, commerce, or digital experience development • Experience with research, process design, requirements gathering, data analysis / visualization, or program management through academic projects or internships • Foundational understanding of experience, automation, and AI technologies, such as Adobe, Salesforce, Google, Microsoft, and others • Familiarity with human-centered design, persona development, agile product management, PowerPoint storytelling, and design thinking CDP - Industry X • Work with cutting-edge technologies like Big Data Analytics, AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT), Cybersecurity, Robotics, and 5G. • Leverage engineering and manufacturing expertise to assist clients in sustainably reimagining the design, manufacturing, and servicing of their products. • Inspire change through process transformation, product design, build and delivery. • Contribute to initiatives that enhance productivity, product quality, worker safety, and sustainability in a real-world digital environment. Apply modern tech and operational models to improve areas such as manufacturing, maintenance, and quality control. • Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation, based on full-time employment, for roles that may be hired in British Columbia as set forth below. Information on benefits is here. Role Location Hourly Rate Range British Columbia $28.00 to $28.00 Job Requirements Qualifications What We're Looking For…. Required Qualifications: • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in any discipline (preferably Analytics, Business Administration, Data Analysis, Economics, Electrical Engineering, Engineering, Finance, Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Marketing, Mechanical Engineering, and Supply Chain) with an expected graduation date between December 2026 and August 2027. • Prior internship or work experience. • If applying for Montreal location, must be fluently bilingual in English and French If applying for Ottawa location, must be eligible for Security Clearance • Preferred Qualifications: • Prior internship experience in consulting, technology, or professional services. • Project experience through work or coursework by developing and implementing solutions to solve real-world business challenges, demonstrating a consulting mindset. • Leadership experience through student organizations or extracurricular activities. • A growth mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and development. • Familiarity with programming languages, data visualization tools, and/or cloud platforms. • Knowledge of core consulting skills - business processes, organizational strategies, project management and an interest in technology. • Ability to work with data to solve real-world problems and present findings clearly. Effective communicator in a presentation setting. • English is required for this position as this role will regularly interact with English-speaking stakeholders across Canada. Due to the significant high volume of interactions with these English-speaking stakeholders, which is inherent to this position, it is not possible to reorganize the company's activities to avoid this requirement. This role involves working in person-either at our offices, client sites, or delivery centers-so you can collaborate effectively and build strong relationships with teammates and clients. Please note that with all of our roles, you should expect to be in-person for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders and communities. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
